  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-32442].
  {panel}

The column order is breaking (revert to old order) for that issue after you perform editing on that issue and return to the search result.

*Steps to Replicate*
# Create a new filter
# Modify the column order, by Clicking on Tools and Set Filter Column Order
# Randomly move the column order or add column
# Select an issue on the list
# Edit any field of the issue
# Click on Return to Search
# Noticed the Column Order Break for that particular issue when viewing on Issue Navigator

*Screenshot*
!columnordererror.JPG!

*Additional Information*
* Tested consistent on all supported browser
* Screen Capture uploaded below to show the steps I used to replicate
fields.summary: Column Order Break for the Issue after Return to Search at Issue Navigator

fields.description:
h3. Problem
When setting the umask to 0077 the JIRA Installer does not set files with correct permissions.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Perform the following steps to reproduce this (as root):
{code}
umask 0077
umask
wget http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/downloads/binary/atlassian-jira-5.1.8-x64.bin
sh atlassian-jira-5.1.8-x64.bin
cd jira_install/
find . -name "ApplicationPropertiesJira*"
cd ./atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes/com/atlassian/jira/startup/
ls -la
history | cut -c 8-
{code}

Simple example in the folder /atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes/com/atlassian/jira/startup
{code}
-rw-------  1 root root  1954 2012-10-29 01:27 ApplicationPropertiesJiraHomePathLocator$1.class
-rw-r--r--  1 root root  1658 2012-10-29 01:27 ApplicationPropertiesJiraHomePathLocator.class
{code}

Note that in the subclass file the group and global permissions are not set. This is problematic.

Additionally, the shell scripts will not be provided with the appropriate permissions so JIRA will not be able to be started:

{noformat}
[root@hercules tmp]# /etc/init.d/jira start
To run JIRA in the foreground, start the server with start-jira.sh -fg
executing using dedicated user: jira
bash: ./startup.sh: Permission denied
{noformat}

The same goes for upgrades as it does for installs.

h3. Workarounds:
# Set umask to something else (eg: 0022) prior to installation
# Fix the file permissions after install:
{code}
chmod -R u=rwx,g=rx,o=rx /var/atlassian/application-data/jira 
chmod -R u=rwx,g=rx,o=rx /opt/atlassian/jira/
{code}
fields.summary: JIRA Linux Installer does not set files with correct permissions when a non-default umask is used

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a user picker field (such as assignee) is on a transition screen (and that transition has a validator for another field, permission or condition) a fail to transition will cause the user picker to default to the username (and changes will be lost).

h3. Steps to Reproduce
As an administrator...
# Create a new screen, and add the "Assignee" field to the screen
# Create a new transition, using the the screen you just created for it
# On that transition, add a Permission Validator (for example, administer projects)
# Publish the workflow

As a user that does not have that permission...
# As a user that does not have that permission, attempt to transition the issue
# On the transition screen, change the "Assignee" field

h3. Expected Results
The transition fails, but the changes you've made to the assignee field persist. Additionally, the user's display name is shown in the assignee field.

h3. Actual Results
The transition fails, and the changes you've made to the assignee field may be lost. Additionally, the user's user name is shown in the assignee field (rather than their display name)
 
h3. Notes
* The username may be hard to distinguish at a glance in environments that use homogenous usernames (i.e 123456 instead of user_name)
* In newer versions of Jira, it seems that the changes to the "Assignee" (or other user field) are kept; although the username shows
* In newer versions of Jira, it seems that as soon as the "Assignee" (or other user field) revert back to the display name as soon as that field loses focus
* This can be reproduced with other third party validators, such as the "Field is Required" from JSU

h3.Workaround
There is no workaround for this issue.
fields.summary: Failure on validator causes Display Name to be replaced by username
Ability to block attachments from incoming mails

Link types should be i18n compatible.
fields.summary: Translating(or changing name) issue linking name, will prevent creating reciprocal link when cloning a issue.

fields.description:
First reported as https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/PL-2797

User has issue types with custom images that have spaces in names. These spaces are not encoded when you query issue types using REST. 

This causes JRJC to fail retrieval of issue types because it assumes that iconUrl attribute actually is a URL and tries to parse it as such. 

Example JSON:

{noformat}

[{"self":"http://localhost:8091/rest/api/2/issuetype/4","id":"4","description":"An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.","iconUrl":"http://localhost:8091/images/icons/improvement.gif","name":"Improvement","subtask":false},{"self":"http://localhost:8091/rest/api/2/issuetype/3","id":"3","description":"A task that needs to be done.","iconUrl":"http://localhost:8091/images/icons/task.gif","name":"Task","subtask":false},{"self":"http://localhost:8091/rest/api/2/issuetype/5","id":"5","description":"The sub-task of the issue","iconUrl":"http://localhost:8091/images/icons/issuetypes/subtask_alternate.png","name":"Sub-task","subtask":true},{"self":"http://localhost:8091/rest/api/2/issuetype/1","id":"1","description":"A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.","iconUrl":"http://localhost:8091/images/icons/bug.gif","name":"Bug","subtask":false},{"self":"http://localhost:8091/rest/api/2/issuetype/2","id":"2","description":"A new feature of the product, which has yet to be developed.","iconUrl":"http://localhost:8091/images/icons/newfeature.gif","name":"New Feature","subtask":false},{"self":"http://localhost:8091/rest/api/2/issuetype/6","id":"6","description":"","iconUrl":"http://localhost:8091/images/icons/ala ma kota 2.png","name":"bolek","subtask":false}]
{noformat}
fields.summary: Issue type icon URLs are not encoded when presented in REST API, which causes REST clients to fail parsing issue types

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-32414].
  {panel}

Create a custom Free Text field.
Add some descriptive text in the Description box.
In the Field Configuration, make sure that your new Text Field uses a Wiki Style Renderer.

PROBLEM: The descriptive text is separated from the field/box by the two little icons (Preview and MarkupHelp). This makes it very unclear what the Description refers to. This is especially noticeable if there are several Free Text fields on the screen. The location of the Description makes it look like it refers to the subsequent Text Field.

REQUEST: Please relocate the icons or the text. (Or float them side-by-side)
fields.summary: relocate the explanatory text of custom (wiki-rendered) fields

fields.description:
When performing a Single Level Group By Report, only statistics that return a user-defined value are displaying headers. The issues are broken down into groups, but the groups are unlabeled.

Examples of fields that work:
Assignee
Reporter
Project
Component

Examples of fields that do not work:
Status
Issue Type
Priority

Please see the attached example. 

Thanks!
fields.summary: Single Level Group By report - headings not displayed for some statistic types
using REST calls, I can't create an issue with a priority having "id" : 3. It must be "id" : "3"

fields.description:
Within an instance got around 1500 projets, launch the following query: 
# With the "in" operator:
{code}
project = test and status in (Open, Resolved)
{code}
The query return the output in average 5 seconds.
# Without the "in" operator:
{code}
(project = test and status = Open) or (project = test and status = Resolved)
{code}
The query return the same output in average 100 millisecond.

The root cause of the issue seems to be that when JIRA is preparing the context of the JQL, the project filter is not taken into account, which make the search across all project instead. 

This is have a huge impact on the customer side for some queries can up to a couple minutes to finish the query event there are not much issue in the project. 

As possible workaround solution, please make sure that all status are added in all workflow to reduce the context affect on the context construction procedure.
fields.summary: The "in" operator cause performance issue when having a huge number of project
When I'm mentioned on a JIRA I'm assigned, send me a mention email rather than a comment email

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
* When project name ends with "#" (and maybe some other special symbols), no reports are able to open. Instead, error message showed:

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Name a project ending the name with a "#"
# Go to any system report

h3. Expected Results
* Reports work normally

h3. Actual Results
* Reports are broken, showing the following error:
{code}Configure Report - Error
No report was specified. The 'reportKey' parameter was empty.{code}

h3. Workaround
* Manually move "&projectOrFilterName" parameter to the end of address string in browser's address bar on error page — it will work. Example:
{code}
Not working:
http://servername:8080/jira/secure/ConfigureReport!default.jspa?selectedProjectId=10000&projectOrFilterId=project-10000&projectOrFilterName=Demonstration#&reportKey=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.reports:developer-workload

Working:
* http://servername:8080/jira/secure/ConfigureReport!default.jspa?selectedProjectId=10000&projectOrFilterId=project-10000&reportKey=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.reports:developer-workload&projectOrFilterName=Demonstration#{code}

* Remove the #/especial symbol from the name of the project.
fields.summary: When project name ends with symbol "#", reports do not open

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-32394].
  {panel}

# Set your account's profile timezone to differ from the server (I created a new OnDemand instance set to US/Chicago then set my profile to Australia/Sydney).
# Start a new basic search, add Due Date to the fields.
# Select "Date between" and choose two different dates (say, 2nd April and 6th April).
# Save that filter, then reload the page.

The dates will have changed to 1st April and 5th April and are saved directly in the database with these values. Advanced Search in unaffected, this only occurs with Basic Search. It _doesn't_ occur if your profile timezone is set to the same timezone as the JIRA server is (be it by manually selecting the same timezone or choosing "JIRA default").

I've been able to replicate this in SAC as well.
fields.summary: "Date Between" search in Basic Search changes dates upon saving if profile timezone differs from server timezone
"new comment" indicator

fields.description: Often, when attaching a tall image, it gets a fixed width on the thumbnail, causing the image to flow all the way down into the comments section. When this happens, it can be impossible to delete the image using the trash can icon (you have to Manage Attachments to delete). It is random when it decides to do this. Sometimes, we'll try to attach the same file again and it will attach with the default-sized thumbnail. I've attached an example of this happening in our sub-task.
fields.summary: Images often attach incorrectly when using Attach Files in JIRA

fields.description:

The same is true of the 'Import Id' type

fields.description:

  {panel}

# Set a version release date
# Look at Change Log or browser Versions page
(i) This issue happens only if the default JIRA timezone differs from the server OS timezone.

h3. Expected
Date is the same as on Manage Versions page

h3. Actual
Date is one day earlier on Change Log and browse Versions page

h3. Work-around

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-32387].
  {panel}

h3. Summary:
We know that exist REST APIs under */rest/gadget* because we can call the following URLs and it will return information:

* http://localhost:8080/rest/gadget/1.0/currentUser
* http://localhost:8080/rest/gadget/1.0/filtersAndProjects?showFilters=false

h3. The problem:
The problem is that there isn't any documentation describing all the available REST APIs for it. Currently the docs about REST APIs don't include any reference to */rest/gadget*. See the following links:

* https://developer.atlassian.com/static/rest/jira/5.2.9.html
* http://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/latest/
fields.summary: Update REST API documentation to include information under gadget API

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-32386].
  {panel}

When a Project has a default issue security level set for all newly created issues, and a user (who is *not allowed* to view the issue because of the default security level set) tries to create an issue from email with attachments, the issue is created successfully but the attachments are rejected with the following error message that is added as a comment on the issue:
{noformat}
Reporter (johndoe) does not have permission to create attachments in project XXXX. 
Following attachments found in the email have been discarded:
aaa.xlsx
bbb.jpg
{noformat}

-This has been reproduced in a 5.1.8 instance, but isn't reproduceable in 5.2.5.- now also happening on 6.3-OD-04-019

*Steps to reproduce:*
# Create an issue security scheme in a project, with security levels restricting a particular user (reporter) from viewing the issue. Set this is as the default issue security level.
# Have that user create an issue via email with attachments.
# Observe that issue is created successfully, but permissions message is created as a comment on the issue and attachments are dropped. [^Untitled.jpg]

Screenshots added showing the same attachment sent via email to the same project when there is no Issue Security Scheme restricting the user (test_attachment_OK.jpeg) and later after adding Issue Security Scheme restricting the user (test_attachment_FAIL.jpeg)
fields.summary: Mail Handler unable to create attachments from email when reporter is not in the default issue security level

fields.summary: The "jira.home" property is always empty

fields.description:
JIRA is connected with Crowd, that syncs with an LDAP that does not support incremental synchronization and even after disabling the incremental sync in JIRA's directory settings, you keep receiving:
{noformat}
2013-04-01 10:00:03,234 QuartzWorker-0 WARN [directory.ldap.cache.EventTokenChangedCacheRefresher] Incremental synchronisation is not available. Falling back to full synchronisation
com.atlassian.crowd.event.IncrementalSynchronisationNotAvailableException: Incremental synchronisation is not guaranteed to be available
 at com.atlassian.crowd.integration.rest.service.RestCrowdClient.getCurrentEventToken(RestCrowdClient.java:948)
 at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.RemoteCrowdDirectory.getCurrentEventToken(RemoteCrowdDirectory.java:651)
 at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.ldap.cache.EventTokenChangedCacheRefresher.synchroniseAll(EventTokenChangedCacheRefresher.java:45)
 at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.DbCachingRemoteDirectory.synchroniseCache(DbCachingRemoteDirectory.java:619)
 at com.atlassian.crowd.manager.directory.DirectorySynchroniserImpl.synchronise(DirectorySynchroniserImpl.java:63)
 at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.DbCachingDirectoryPoller.pollChanges(DbCachingDirectoryPoller.java:50)
 at com.atlassian.crowd.manager.directory.monitor.poller.DirectoryPollerJob.execute(DirectoryPollerJob.java:34)
{noformat}

Crowd version is 2.3.6 using a Delegated Auth Directory
fields.summary: Disable Incremental Synchronization not working

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a project admin page is visited, we perform a check for plugin updates (/rest/plugins/1.0/notifications). If the user visiting the page is not a JIRA administrator, they will not have permission to access the UPM. This results in a 401 error for that call. 

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Login as a regular Project Administrator (user who has administer project permission on a test project, but who is not a JIRA Admin or System Admin)
# Access the administration page of same test project, and click on any of the project admin tabs e.g. versions, components etc.

h3. Expected results
There aren't requests on the page that return a 401. Either no unauthorized requests are triggered or atleast they return a more appropriate 403 response.

h3. Actual results
A 401 is returned, as well as a, WWW-Authenticate header for requests to /rest/plugins/1.0/notifications
 !Selection_168.jpg|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
A similar issue was found in OnDemand: https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/UPM-2684. Not sure if this issue should be a JIRA fix to handle the call better, or if the UPM is adding this call in, and the above issue should be re-opened to extend to BTF instances as well.
fields.summary: 401 on project admin page when viewed as a non jira-admin user

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-32372].
  {panel}

Encountering a javascript error while adding a validator to a transition step.
Using the "Fields Required Validator" which is part of the plugin "JIRA Suite Utilities 1.3.5".

Webpage error details

User Agent: Mozilla/4.0 (compatible; MSIE 8.0; Windows NT 6.1; Trident/4.0; SLCC2; .NET CLR 2.0.50727; .NET CLR 3.5.30729; .NET CLR 3.0.30729; .NET4.0C; .NET4.0E; InfoPath.3; MS-RTC LM 8)
Timestamp: Thu, 28 Mar 2013 19:11:45 UTC

Message: Invalid argument.
Line: 1169
Char: 5
Code: 0
URI: ..../secure/admin/workflows/AddWorkflowTransitionValidatorParams!default.jspa?workflowName=TEST&workflowMode=draft&workflowStep=3&workflowTransition=21&pluginModuleKey=com.googlecode.jira-suite-utilities%3AfieldsRequired-validator&atl_token=B1WN-TYSP-CPIX-MQW8%7C5e021176442d90d4f88cbd55d13cd44686cdbd5d%7Clin

Env:

IE 8.0
JIRA 5.2.7
JIRA Suite Utilities 1.3.5

Note: This works fine while updating the workflow in the text mode while using Firefox.
fields.summary: IE Javascript error while adding a validator to a transition in Workflow

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-32371].
  {panel}

After the last OnDemand upgrade, users are not able to perform the following operations anymore (using Google Chrome and Mozilla Firefox):

- *Shift* + Left-Click = Open ticket in a new *window*
- *Ctrl* + Left-Click = Open ticket in a new *tab*

For instance, when performing an JQL search, user usually would use *Ctrl* + Click to open issues in new tabs. This doesn't happen anymore, both operations now open the ticket on the same window.

This slows down significantly the use of JIRA.
fields.summary: Users unable to open tickets in new windows/tabs

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-32367].
  {panel}

when we create a custom field name with one long word or few words, the create issue screen will show the name in multiple lines instead of one line (Please refer to the screenshot attached).
!TooLong.PNG!

It would be nice if the name will be scaled into one line instead.

Suggestions:
# One customer suggested that the font of the custom field name will be smaller so that it will scale into the space given for the name.
# Another suggestion would be to make it configurable, in case some users want it to be two lines instead of one.
fields.summary: Better rendering on the create issue screen when the custom field is too long.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-32353].
  {panel}

Due to a security risk it was decided that only system-administrators have the permission to upload workflow bundles to JIRA. As no customer in JIRA OnDemand has system-admin privileges, it is not possible to upload workflows.

The use case satisfied by doing this work is:
* Allow imports between OD instances
* Allow imports between OD instance and BTF (and vice versa)
fields.summary: Give administrators the permission to upload/import workflow bundles
Excel Export Is Broken With Office 2010 or 2013 / LibreOffice / Numbers

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-32350].
  {panel}

I've seen two cases now where the Outgoing Mail page has said that outgoing mail is disabled, but the big button to enable mail is not visible to regular admins, only sysadmins.

It should be visible for admins as well.

Because of how OnDemand vs BTF work we should:

* Create an option on the JIRA Mail Queue page or the General Config page for enabling / disabling mail
* Only show this option if the instance is an OnDemand instance, not for BTF

This prevents us revealing the mail config page in OD and prevents doubling up config options for BTF customers
fields.summary: "Enable Outgoing Mail" button on the Outgoing Mail admin page should be visible to regular admins, not just sysadmins
No way to close add/remove group dialog box without making a group change.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-32347].
{panel}
JIRA does not officially document the support of Maria DB, or indicate any support for this. As some major Linux distributions are moving to use MariaDB and the functionality is similar, it would be good to provide support for this Database version.
h3. Suggested Solution

Officially support MariaDB for JIRA, including adding documentation and any other articles as required.
h3. Workaround

MySQL can be installed on RHEL, Oracle Linux, CentOS and Fedora using the MySQL Yum repository, [https://dev.mysql.com/downloads/repo/yum/]. The [Quick Guide to Using the MySQL Yum Repository|https://dev.mysql.com/doc/mysql-yum-repo-quick-guide/en/] walks through how to configure the repository and install MySQL.
fields.summary: Add MariaDB as a supported platform for Jira

fields.description:
h5. Problem:

*Field Configuration* allows for setting descriptions for the *Issue Type* field.  This current dispalys for all screens with the exception of the *Create Issue* pop-up.
* displays on Edit screen
* displays on any transition screen
* does not display on Create

h5. Tested on
* JIRA 5.0.6, 5.2.9

h5. Steps to Reproduce
* JIRA Administration > Issues > Fields > Field Configurations
* configure the Field Configuration and locate the *Issue Type* field
* Click Edit and add a description
* Notice that it does not appear for Create screen.

Screenshots for more info.
fields.summary: The Issue Type field description does not display on the Create Issue pop-up

fields.description: All issues will shown, when i select the 'Reported by Me' option from Issues drop down. On the left side panel it shows the filter as 'Reported by Me', however results shows the issues created by all users.
fields.summary: Some time 'reported by me filter' is not showing the issues created by the actual user.
Option to disable profile editing
Be able to delegate user group administration to users

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-32341].
  {panel}

Before JIRA 5.2.6, if you clone an issue, the links appeared in the wrong way, as stated in the following bug:

- [Clone operation creates links in the wrong direction|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-24563]

This was fixed in JIRA 5.2.6 and now the new links are showing correctly. The problem is the cloned issues made before this upgrade, they will not be fixed after the upgrade and will remain with the wrong association. The best solution for this would be a fix during the upgrade, so the old cloned issues will show the right links.

h3. Workaround: 
-- [How to Fix Links in Wrong Direction After Cloning an Issue|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/How+to+Fix+Links+in+Wrong+Direction+After+Cloning+an+Issue]
fields.summary: Wrong links made before JIRA 5.2.6 remains in JIRA
When importing a backup that includes embedded crowd data, the osuser.xml can delete embedded crowd directories, groups, and memberships

fields.description:
h4. Problem Description:
LDAP connector or (Crowd application with LDAP connector) has been one of customer favourite configuration. However, there are times that the user would be leave the company and some administrator would remove that inactive user from LDAP directory. Thus, it caused that the user to be removed the directory within crowd or JIRA. However, the removed user would still be remain as the assignee of some issues although the user and the associated membership were completely removed from related directory.

We can still update a ticket which the assignee was the removed user through the GUI edit operation or inline edit. However, when trying to update or transition through REST API or REST client, the update operation failed.

h5. Step to Reproduce:
# Create a user(eg. testuser) in LDAP server
# Setup a read only LDAP directory in JIRA (it can be achieve through crowd connected to Read Only LDAP connector) then synchronize the directory to allow the user added into JIRA
# Ensure the user has the assignable permission. For easier replication, grant user all the groups permission.
# Create a test issue and assign to the testuser
# Remove the user from LDAP server
# Perform the any update cURL command or update an issue through REST client and the error will be show up.

h5. cURL command triggered:
{code}
curl -D- -u admin:admin -X POST --data @"Desktop\data.json" -H "Content-Type: application/json" http://localhost:8527/rest/api/2/issue/DEMO-15/transitions?expand=transitions.fields
{code}

h5. Error thrown in the command prompt:
{code}
HTTP/1.1 400 Bad Request
Server: Apache-Coyote/1.1
X-AREQUESTID: 1330x1630x1
Set-Cookie: JSESSIONID=DBB357E7C30BC89A15A1944475C59D13; Path=/; HttpOnly
X-Seraph-LoginReason: OK
Set-Cookie: atlassian.xsrf.token=BQ3E-463Q-AVK1-5MLS|0c3a3da6067e31a4881f77b6ac2c58dbe39f9a37|lin; Path=/
X-ASESSIONID: 30rkz
X-AUSERNAME: admin
Cache-Control: no-cache, no-store, no-transform
Content-Type: application/json;charset=UTF-8
Transfer-Encoding: chunked
Date: Wed, 27 Mar 2013 14:10:00 GMT
Connection: close

{"errorMessages":[],"errors":{"assignee":"User 'testuser' does not exist."}}
{code}

h5. Error thrown in the REST Client through IDE when run the project:
{code}
Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NullPointerException
	at RestTry.main(RestTry.java:40)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:597)
	at com.intellij.rt.execution.application.AppMain.main(AppMain.java:120)
{code}

h5. Workaround
Create the user back into the LDAP server without any group membership and synchronize the user back to JIRA. However, make sure the username still remain the same as the name it was removed earlier.
fields.summary: REST api failed if the assignee is invalid user(non-existent user)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-32337].
  {panel}

This would be similar to the "Filter Results" - but the JQL would be entered directy in the Gadget (See Screenshot).

The reson is, that the filter-gadget binding is hard to maintain whith many users, hence to:

1. Sharing
2. Changing
3. Users implementing Shared filters on the own pages
4. No reverse governance - as in: Where is this filter used?

So entering the JQL directly in the gadget would fix it closer to the Dashboard
fields.summary: Inline search Gadget

fields.description:
Here is the steps to reproduce the issue:
# Install a scratch instance with one user and a starter license.
# create a new user group "jira-test" and add the admin user in the group.
# On the LDAP repository, create the same admin user, with those three default JIRA groups and the new group "jira-test", then add the admin user to the default groups only.
# Create a new user directory on JIRA with the LDAP connector by using the read only ldap permission. 
# Push the new user directory in the first place and trigger the synchronization.
# Logout then login again with the LDAP admin user. 
# go to the license page, it shows there are two active users which is wrong as only admin user is active for the instance. 

This issue only reproduced with the newly created groups, but also, it could happen for the default groups as well.

As a workaround solution, it can add the admin user in the new group on the LDAP repository.
fields.summary: Active User count not correct toward license with duplicated created group

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

Share an issue with yourself using your account name.
No email.
Share the same issue with yourself using your email.
Receive notification.
Configure profile to notify yourself on your own changes.
Share an issue with yourself.
Receive notification.

Explicitly sharing an issue with yourself should not be controlled by the notify me on my changes setting.

fields.description:
h4. Actual behavior:

When your Notifications in JIRA are set to text instead of HTML, the issue details will include the _Original Estimate_ and _Remaining Estimate_ fields.

However, when you *Share* an issue, instead of filling those fields with data, JIRA is sending mails without parsing the field values:

{noformat}
Original Estimate: $issue.getNiceTimeOriginalEstimate($i18n)
Remaining Estimate: $issue.getNiceTimeEstimate($i18n)
{noformat}

h4. Expected behavior:

The text should be properly parsed.

h4. Steps to reproduce:

# Create an issue
# Set your profile to get Text notifications
# Edit the issue and add some value in the Remaining Estimate.
# Share the issue with yourself.

h4. Notes:
Looking in detail, seems like this is coming from {{$JIRA_INSTALL/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes/templates/email/text/includes/issuesummary.vm}}.

h4. Workaround:

Use HTML Notifications.
fields.summary: Share Issue not parsing all fields
